title: Linux mdu Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the mdu command in Linux, learn to measure disk usage, and exclude specific files and directories from the analysis.

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the mdu Command

verify.name: Verify mdu command usage
verify.hint: Ensure that you can run the `mdu` command with the `-h` option to display the disk usage of the `~/project` directory in a human-readable format.

steps.title: Measure the Disk Usage of a Directory

verify.name: Verify mdu command usage for a directory
verify.hint: Ensure that you can run the `mdu` command with the `-h` option to display the correct disk usage of the `~/project/documents` directory, which should be 36K.

steps.title: Exclude Specific Files and Directories from the mdu Command

verify.name: Verify mdu command exclusion
verify.hint: Ensure that you can run the `mdu` command with the `-x` option to exclude the `~/project/temp` and `~/project/backup` directories, and that the total disk usage of the `~/project` directory is correctly reported as 60K.
